page.title: 07FARMING
page.content: BONFIELD'S DAIRY The Bonfields own the farm.They have 96 fully grown cows and 80 young ones. They have 40 calves this year.From each cow they get 28 pints of milk a day and they enjoy milking the cows. They milk the cows twice a day at 7.30 and 4.15.They said one hundred cows will eat one acre of grass in a day. All of the cows have names.They all have a favourite cow.Mr.Bonfields favourite is number 33 named Watarhall Bread June.All of the 96 cows are pregnant at some time in the year.They have two bulls named Grove Liberator and Heathbrow Excellence.All of their cows are British Friesians (Reds and Blacks).Their oldest piece of machinery is a combine.They don't grow silage but next year they will.They do grow crops on the land and have 100 acres of grass and 10 of corn.
